conclusion: Liquid will flow out from openings A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E or F.
Opening A is located at the top left and is green.
Opening B is located next to A and is orange.
Opening C is located next to B and is white.
Opening D is located at the far right and is blue.
Container E is purple and located on the left side at the bottom.
Container F is yellow and located on the right side at the bottom.
The baffles are slanted bars positioned to deflect liquid streams either left or right.

premise: Liquid from opening A strikes the yellow slanted baffle first.
conclusion: Liquid from opening A is deflected to the right.

premise: Liquid from opening A then strikes the gray slanted baffle.
conclusion: Liquid from opening A is deflected to the left and ends up left of the middle divider.

premise: Liquid from opening A ends up left of the middle divider.
conclusion: Liquid from opening A enters container E.

premise: Liquid from opening B strikes the yellow slanted baffle first.
conclusion: Liquid from opening B is deflected to the right.

premise: Liquid from opening B never crosses back to the left side.
conclusion: Liquid from opening B enters container F.

premise: Liquid from opening C strikes the orange slanted baffle first.
conclusion: Liquid from opening C is deflected to the left.

premise: Liquid from opening C then strikes the white slanted baffle.
conclusion: Liquid from opening C is deflected to the right and stays on the right side.

premise: Liquid from opening C stays on the right side.
conclusion: Liquid from opening C enters container F.
